TopicTitle: Best way to destroy or remove debris?

Articles.Content:
What is the best way to clean up all the failures that lay around the air strip and launch pad?

Have any of you created any vehicles for cleaning debris?

Are there any methods for cleaning debris.

Help me clean up Kerbal!!!
Load the start screen and press settings, then drag the persistent debris bar down to 0 to remove all debris.
Do it my way.Send in an unmanned rocket and slam into them :3
@Miniboyss // Mmmmmmmm... Well that's one way of doing it.. I was wondering about destroying it with vehicles created for removing or destroying Debris.

Like the suggestion above; set persistent debris to zero or... Just load/focus on the debris like you would with any other vessel and hit end flight. Both kind of cheating, but those are the easiest ways. If you don't want to cheat or anything; Design the rocket on a way that you have a probe core on the debris you left behind. So you could still control them like a separed vessel and deorbit them. But that's totally up to you..

Edited May 2, 2013 by JSD

Use the Sunbean laser mod:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/sunbeam/

For that purpose I made unmanned craft with arm from Romfarer robotic arms pack.

Just need to rendevous with debris, grab it and deorbit.

But it's only for rare cases when things did not deorbit by themselves, normally I design everything so I can deorbit every spend stage by itself (avey stage witch is dropped on orbit has probe core and some fuel left)

I would get that mod only to mawl things.

And maybe play baseball.

I have tested the Bombs pack with the nuke..

Nuke is ****HIGHLY EFFECTIVE****

IT ALSO BLEW THE TAIL OFF THE AIRCRAFT THAT DROPPED IT!!!

Maybe I should drop from a higher altitude xDDD
I like to make a monstrosity out of struts and landing legs that i send to rendezvous with the debris. Then I grab the debris with from its lofty orbit and retro burn until I smack into the surface.

Use the Sunbean laser mod

No mods? Send a vehicle out to each part. Give it a storage space. Have Danlon & Harger K. jump out, then bracket to each part and end it. Return to base.

Danlon & Harger: Signed up for the kerbalnaut program, wound up grounded on salvage duty. They've been known to just push parts onto the runway so someone else can clean them up.
